Mercury::CondemnedChannels

Mercury::CondemnedChannels Class Reference

This class is used handle channels that will be deleted once they have no unacked packets. More...

Detailed Description

This class is used handle channels that will be deleted once they have no unacked packets.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Mercury::CondemnedChannels::CondemnedChannels (  )  [inline]

Mercury::CondemnedChannels::~CondemnedChannels (  ) 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void Mercury::CondemnedChannels::add ( Channel *  pChannel  ) 

This method takes care of deleting the input channel.

It will wait until there are no unacked packets before deleting the channel.

bool Mercury::CondemnedChannels::deleteFinishedChannels (  ) 

This method deletes any condemned channels that are now considered finished.

This can be from having no more unacked packets or timing out

Returns:
true if there are no more condemned channels, otherwise false.

Channel * Mercury::CondemnedChannels::find ( ChannelID  channelID  )  const

This method returns the indexed channel matching the input id.

int Mercury::CondemnedChannels::numCriticalChannels (  )  const

This method returns the number of condemned channels that are marked as 'critical'.
